meanings.sent1: The baby started outbawling when she dropped her toy.
meanings.sent2: She was outbawling in the park after losing her favorite hat.
meanings.sent3: The puppy was outbawling for more treats, hoping to get extra.
meanings.sent4: The thunderstorm seemed to be outbawling with its booming sounds.
meanings.sent5: The singer's emotional performance had the audience outbawling with tears.

meanings.definition: To shout louder than someone else.
meanings.sent1: During the game, he started outbawling instructions to his teammates.
meanings.sent2: The coach was outbawling from the sidelines to motivate the players.
meanings.sent3: The parrot was outbawling the owner's commands, trying to mimic them.
meanings.sent4: The megaphone made his voice outbawling over the crowd noise.
meanings.sent5: The auctioneer was outbawling the bids, trying to get the highest offer.

meanings.definition: To surpass in crying or shouting.
meanings.sent1: She always outbawled her siblings when it came to expressing emotions.
meanings.sent2: The opera singer outbawled all others with her powerful voice.
meanings.sent3: The cat outbawled the dog in a vocal competition for attention.
meanings.sent4: The wind outbawled the trees as it howled through the night.
meanings.sent5: The actor outbawled his co-stars in the emotional scene, stealing the spotlight.
